title: Learning to Remove Lens Flare in Event Camera
comment: Preprint; 29 pages, 14 figures, 4 tables; Project Page at https://e-flare.github.io/
summary: Event cameras have the potential to revolutionize vision systems with their high temporal resolution and dynamic range, yet they remain susceptible to lens flare, a fundamental optical artifact that causes severe degradation. In event streams, this optical artifact forms a complex, spatio-temporal distortion that has been largely overlooked. We present E-Deflare, the first systematic framework for removing lens flare from event camera data. We first establish the theoretical foundation by deriving a physics-grounded forward model of the non-linear suppression mechanism. This insight enables the creation of the E-Deflare Benchmark, a comprehensive resource featuring a large-scale simulated training set, E-Flare-2.7K, and the first-ever paired real-world test set, E-Flare-R, captured by our novel optical system. Empowered by this benchmark, we design E-DeflareNet, which achieves state-of-the-art restoration performance. Extensive experiments validate our approach and demonstrate clear benefits for downstream tasks. Code and datasets are publicly available.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了E-Deflare，这是首个系统性地从事件相机数据中去除镜头光晕的框架，通过建立物理基础的前向模型、创建大规模基准数据集E-Deflare Benchmark，并设计了达到最先进恢复性能的E-DeflareNet。
AI.motivation: 事件相机虽然具有高时间分辨率和动态范围的优势，但仍易受镜头光晕这一基本光学伪影的影响，导致严重退化。在事件流中，这种光学伪影形成复杂时空扭曲，但此前研究对此关注不足，缺乏系统性解决方案。
AI.method: 本文首先建立了理论基础，推导了非线性抑制机制的物理基础前向模型。基于此洞察创建了E-Deflare Benchmark，包含大规模模拟训练集E-Flare-2.7K和首个配对真实世界测试集E-Flare-R。利用该基准，设计了E-DeflareNet框架来实现镜头光晕去除。
AI.result: E-DeflareNet在镜头光晕去除任务中达到了最先进的恢复性能。大量实验验证了该方法的有效性，并证明了对下游任务的明显益处。所提出的基准数据集和代码均已公开可用。
AI.conclusion: 该研究为事件相机镜头光晕问题提供了首个系统性解决方案，填补了该领域的研究空白。通过建立物理模型和创建基准数据集，为后续研究奠定了基础。实验结果表明该方法能有效提升事件相机视觉系统的鲁棒性和实用性。

title: CS3D: An Efficient Facial Expression Recognition via Event Vision
summary: Responsive and accurate facial expression recognition is crucial to human-robot interaction for daily service robots. Nowadays, event cameras are becoming more widely adopted as they surpass RGB cameras in capturing facial expression changes due to their high temporal resolution, low latency, computational efficiency, and robustness in low-light conditions. Despite these advantages, event-based approaches still encounter practical challenges, particularly in adopting mainstream deep learning models. Traditional deep learning methods for facial expression analysis are energy-intensive, making them difficult to deploy on edge computing devices and thereby increasing costs, especially for high-frequency, dynamic, event vision-based approaches. To address this challenging issue, we proposed the CS3D framework by decomposing the Convolutional 3D method to reduce the computational complexity and energy consumption. Additionally, by utilizing soft spiking neurons and a spatial-temporal attention mechanism, the ability to retain information is enhanced, thus improving the accuracy of facial expression detection. Experimental results indicate that our proposed CS3D method attains higher accuracy on multiple datasets compared to architectures such as the RNN, Transformer, and C3D, while the energy consumption of the CS3D method is just 21.97\% of the original C3D required on the same device.

AI.tldr: 本文提出CS3D框架，通过分解3D卷积方法降低计算复杂度和能耗，并利用软脉冲神经元和时空注意力机制增强信息保留能力，从而在事件相机驱动的面部表情识别任务中实现高精度与低能耗的平衡。
AI.motivation: 尽管事件相机在捕捉面部表情变化方面具有高时间分辨率、低延迟和低光照鲁棒性等优势，但传统基于深度学习的面部表情分析方法能耗高，难以部署在边缘计算设备上，这限制了事件视觉方法在高频动态场景中的实际应用。
AI.method: 本文提出CS3D框架，通过分解卷积3D方法来降低计算复杂度和能耗，同时采用软脉冲神经元增强信息保留能力，并结合时空注意力机制进一步提升面部表情检测的准确性。
AI.result: 实验结果表明，CS3D方法在多个数据集上相比RNN、Transformer和C3D等架构获得了更高的准确率，同时其能耗仅为原始C3D方法在相同设备上所需能耗的21.97%。
AI.conclusion: 该研究证明了CS3D框架在事件相机驱动的面部表情识别任务中能够有效平衡精度与能耗，为边缘计算设备部署高效的事件视觉系统提供了可行方案，推动了人机交互中实时表情识别技术的发展。
